meanings.sent1: The cascading waterfall was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: The cascading leaves created a colorful carpet on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The cascading rain made everyone run for cover.
meanings.sent4: Her cascading laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The cascading sunlight through the trees was magical.

meanings.definition: Arranged in a series of stages or levels.
meanings.sent1: The cascading shelves made it easy to see all the books.
meanings.sent2: The cascading hills provided a stunning view of the valley.
meanings.sent3: The cascading colors of the rainbow flag caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: Her cascading hair fell gracefully over her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The cascading rows of seats in the theater ensured a good view for all.

meanings.definition: A process in which something falls or flows in stages.
meanings.sent1: The cascading of the dominoes was mesmerizing to watch.
meanings.sent2: The cascading of information on the internet can be overwhelming.
meanings.sent3: The cascading of events led to an unexpected outcome.
meanings.sent4: The cascading of petals from the flower was like a gentle rain.
meanings.sent5: The cascading of sand in the hourglass marked the passage of time.
